verses.kjv: Nebuchadnezzar the king, unto all people, nations, and languages, that dwell in all the earth; Peace be multiplied unto you.
verses.ct: King Nebuchadnezzar, to every people, nation, and language across the entire earth: May you have abundant peace.

verses.kjv: I thought it good to shew the signs and wonders that the high God hath wrought toward me.
verses.ct: I have decided to share the miraculous signs and wonders that the Most High God has performed for me.

verses.kjv: How great are his signs! and how mighty are his wonders! his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and his dominion is from generation to generation.
verses.ct: How incredible are his signs! How powerful are his wonders! His kingdom lasts forever, and his rule continues through every generation.

verses.kjv: I Nebuchadnezzar was at rest in mine house, and flourishing in my palace:
verses.ct: I, Nebuchadnezzar, was comfortable in my home and prospering in my palace.

verses.kjv: I saw a dream which made me afraid, and the thoughts upon my bed and the visions of my head troubled me.
verses.ct: Then I had a dream that terrified me. The thoughts that came to me in bed and the visions in my mind deeply disturbed me.

verses.kjv: Therefore made I a decree to bring in all the wise men of Babylon before me, that they might make known unto me the interpretation of the dream.
verses.ct: So I issued an order to bring all the wise men of Babylon to me so they could explain what the dream meant.

verses.kjv: Then came in the magicians, the astrologers, the Chaldeans, and the soothsayers: and I told the dream before them; but they did not make known unto me the interpretation thereof.
verses.ct: The magicians, astrologers, Chaldeans, and fortune-tellers all came in. I described the dream to them, but none of them could tell me its meaning.

verses.kjv: But at the last Daniel came in before me, whose name was Belteshazzar, according to the name of my God, and in whom is the spirit of the holy gods: and before him I told the dream, saying,
verses.ct: Finally, Daniel came to me — the one called Belteshazzar after the name of my god — a man who has the spirit of the holy gods in him. I described the dream to him.

verses.kjv: O Belteshazzar, master of the magicians, because I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in thee, and no secret troubleth thee, tell me the visions of my dream that I have seen, and the interpretation thereof.
verses.ct: I said, 'Belteshazzar, chief of the magicians, I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in you and that no mystery is too difficult for you. Here are the visions I saw in my dream — tell me what they mean.'

verses.kjv: Thus were the visions of mine head in my bed; I saw, and behold a tree in the midst of the earth, and the height thereof was great.
verses.ct: 'These were the visions that came to me as I lay in bed: I looked, and there stood a tree at the center of the earth, and it was enormously tall.

verses.kjv: The tree grew, and was strong, and the height thereof reached unto heaven, and the sight thereof to the end of all the earth:
verses.ct: The tree grew large and strong, its top reaching to heaven, and it was visible to the ends of the earth.

verses.kjv: The leaves thereof were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all: the beasts of the field had shadow under it, and the fowls of the heaven dwelt in the boughs thereof, and all flesh was fed of it.
verses.ct: Its leaves were beautiful, its fruit was abundant, and it provided food for everyone. Wild animals rested in its shade, birds nested in its branches, and every living creature was fed from it.

verses.kjv: I saw in the visions of my head upon my bed, and, behold, a watcher and an holy one came down from heaven;
verses.ct: As I continued watching these visions from my bed, I saw a holy watcher coming down from heaven.

verses.kjv: He cried aloud, and said thus, Hew down the tree, and cut off his branches, shake off his leaves, and scatter his fruit: let the beasts get away from under it, and the fowls from his branches:
verses.ct: He called out in a loud voice: "Chop down the tree and cut off its branches! Strip its leaves and scatter its fruit! Drive the animals out from under it and the birds from its branches.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless leave the stump of his roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let his portion be with the beasts in the grass of the earth:
verses.ct: But leave the stump with its roots in the ground, bound with a band of iron and bronze, among the tender grass of the field. Let him be drenched with the dew of heaven, and let him share the ground with the animals among the plants of the earth.

verses.kjv: Let his heart be changed from man’s, and let a beast’s heart be given unto him; and let seven times pass over him.
verses.ct: Let his human mind be taken from him and replaced with the mind of an animal, and let 7 periods of time pass over him."

verses.kjv: This matter is by the decree of the watchers, and the demand by the word of the holy ones: to the intent that the living may know that the most High ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will, and setteth up over it the basest of men.
verses.ct: This sentence was announced by the watchers, this verdict declared by the holy ones, so that every living person may recognize that the Most High has authority over human kingdoms. He gives them to anyone he chooses, and he can place even the lowliest of people over them.'

verses.kjv: This dream I king Nebuchadnezzar have seen. Now thou, O Belteshazzar, declare the interpretation thereof, forasmuch as all the wise men of my kingdom are not able to make known unto me the interpretation: but thou art able; for the spirit of the holy gods is in thee.
verses.ct: 'This is the dream that I, King Nebuchadnezzar, had. Now, Belteshazzar, tell me its meaning, since none of the wise men in my kingdom could interpret it for me. But you can, because the spirit of the holy gods is in you.'

verses.kjv: Then Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, was astonied for one hour, and his thoughts troubled him. The king spake, and said, Belteshazzar, let not the dream, or the interpretation thereof, trouble thee. Belteshazzar answered and said, My lord, the dream be to them that hate thee, and the interpretation thereof to thine enemies.
verses.ct: Then Daniel, also known as Belteshazzar, was stunned and deeply troubled for a while. The king said, 'Belteshazzar, don't let the dream or its meaning alarm you.' Belteshazzar replied, 'My lord, I wish this dream applied to your enemies and its meaning to those who oppose you.'

verses.kjv: The tree that thou sawest, which grew, and was strong, whose height reached unto the heaven, and the sight thereof to all the earth;
verses.ct: 'The tree you saw, which grew large and strong, whose top reached to heaven and was visible across the whole earth,

verses.kjv: Whose leaves were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all; under which the beasts of the field dwelt, and upon whose branches the fowls of the heaven had their habitation:
verses.ct: with beautiful leaves and abundant fruit, providing food for all, with wild animals living under it and birds nesting in its branches —

verses.kjv: It is thou, O king, that art grown and become strong: for thy greatness is grown, and reacheth unto heaven, and thy dominion to the end of the earth.
verses.ct: that tree is you, Your Majesty. You have grown great and powerful. Your greatness has increased until it reaches heaven, and your authority extends to the ends of the earth.

verses.kjv: And whereas the king saw a watcher and an holy one coming down from heaven, and saying, Hew the tree down, and destroy it; yet leave the stump of the roots thereof in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let his portion be with the beasts of the field, till seven times pass over him;
verses.ct: And the holy watcher that Your Majesty saw coming down from heaven and saying, "Chop down the tree and destroy it, but leave the stump and roots in the ground, bound with iron and bronze, among the tender grass. Let him be drenched with the dew of heaven and share the lot of wild animals until 7 periods of time pass over him" —

verses.kjv: This is the interpretation, O king, and this is the decree of the most High, which is come upon my lord the king:
verses.ct: here is what it means, Your Majesty. This is the decree of the Most High that has been issued against my lord the king:

verses.kjv: That they shall drive thee from men, and thy dwelling shall be with the beasts of the field, and they shall make thee to eat grass as oxen, and they shall wet thee with the dew of heaven, and seven times shall pass over thee, till thou know that the most High ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will.
verses.ct: You will be driven away from human society. You will live among wild animals and eat grass like cattle. You will be drenched with the dew of heaven, and 7 periods of time will pass over you, until you acknowledge that the Most High has authority over human kingdoms and gives them to anyone he chooses.

verses.kjv: And whereas they commanded to leave the stump of the tree roots; thy kingdom shall be sure unto thee, after that thou shalt have known that the heavens do rule.
verses.ct: The command to leave the stump and roots of the tree means that your kingdom will be restored to you once you recognize that heaven rules over all.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, O king, let my counsel be acceptable unto thee, and break off thy sins by righteousness, and thine iniquities by shewing mercy to the poor; if it may be a lengthening of thy tranquillity.
verses.ct: Therefore, Your Majesty, please accept my advice: turn away from your sins by doing what is right, and from your wrongdoing by showing mercy to the poor. Perhaps then your prosperity will continue.'

verses.kjv: All this came upon the king Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.ct: All of this happened to King Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.kjv: At the end of twelve months he walked in the palace of the kingdom of Babylon.
verses.ct: 12 months later, he was walking on the roof of the royal palace of Babylon.

verses.kjv: The king spake, and said, Is not this great Babylon, that I have built for the house of the kingdom by the might of my power, and for the honour of my majesty?
verses.ct: The king declared, 'Isn't this the great Babylon that I built as a royal residence by my own mighty power and for the glory of my majesty?'

verses.kjv: While the word was in the king’s mouth, there fell a voice from heaven, saying, O king Nebuchadnezzar, to thee it is spoken; The kingdom is departed from thee.
verses.ct: The words were still on his lips when a voice came from heaven: 'King Nebuchadnezzar, this message is for you: Your royal authority has been taken from you.

verses.kjv: And they shall drive thee from men, and thy dwelling shall be with the beasts of the field: they shall make thee to eat grass as oxen, and seven times shall pass over thee, until thou know that the most High ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will.
verses.ct: You will be driven away from human society. You will live among wild animals and eat grass like cattle. 7 periods of time will pass over you until you acknowledge that the Most High has authority over human kingdoms and gives them to anyone he chooses.'

verses.kjv: The same hour was the thing fulfilled upon Nebuchadnezzar: and he was driven from men, and did eat grass as oxen, and his body was wet with the dew of heaven, till his hairs were grown like eagles’ feathers, and his nails like birds’ claws.
verses.ct: Immediately this was fulfilled. Nebuchadnezzar was driven away from human society. He ate grass like cattle, and his body was drenched with the dew of heaven until his hair grew as long as eagles' feathers and his nails became like birds' claws.

verses.kjv: And at the end of the days I Nebuchadnezzar lifted up mine eyes unto heaven, and mine understanding returned unto me, and I blessed the most High, and I praised and honoured him that liveth for ever, whose dominion is an everlasting dominion, and his kingdom is from generation to generation:
verses.ct: When that time was over, I, Nebuchadnezzar, looked up toward heaven, and my sanity was restored. I praised the Most High and honored and glorified the one who lives forever, whose rule is an eternal rule and whose kingdom endures through every generation.

verses.kjv: And all the inhabitants of the earth are reputed as nothing: and he doeth according to his will in the army of heaven, and among the inhabitants of the earth: and none can stay his hand, or say unto him, What doest thou?
verses.ct: All the people of the earth are considered as nothing compared to him. He does whatever he wants among the armies of heaven and among the people of the earth. No one can hold back his hand or question him, saying, 'What are you doing?'

verses.kjv: At the same time my reason returned unto me; and for the glory of my kingdom, mine honour and brightness returned unto me; and my counsellors and my lords sought unto me; and I was established in my kingdom, and excellent majesty was added unto me.
verses.ct: At that same moment my sanity returned, and my glory, honor, and splendor were restored to me for the sake of my kingdom. My advisors and nobles came looking for me, and I was reestablished on my throne with even greater majesty than before.

verses.kjv: Now I Nebuchadnezzar praise and extol and honour the King of heaven, all whose works are truth, and his ways judgment: and those that walk in pride he is able to abase.
verses.ct: Now I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise, exalt, and honor the King of heaven, because everything he does is right and all his ways are just. And those who live in pride, he is able to humble.
